attributes.action: End the discrimination of Channel Islanders to receive compensation for being held in Far East  POW camps during the second world war
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
British subjects who were held by the Japanese during the second world war and then decided to live in the Channel Islands are excluded from receiving ex gratia payments from the British Goverment . Although the rules have been changed a number of times. the rules now state that British Subjects need to have accumulated 20 years residency in the UK
OR large areas of Europe. The Channel Islands are excempt by the British War & Pensions Dept. The funds for the compensation was made available by the sale of Japanese assets after World War Two so therefore every prisoner is entitled to receive the small amount of compensation.
